title: My PC won't start after a failed update. What do I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thank you for the question. This has happened to me before, once on Windows XP and once on Windows 7. For Windows 10, there is a “Repair Windows” option in your diagnostic blue-screen popup menus (it is in there, but I can’t recall the step-by-step directions as I write this). You may access that on the opening screen before Windows starts. What I would do: Reboot your PC while holding the F8 key to enter SAFE mode. [ For Windows 7 and earlier - that will work (not sure about Win10) ] Then run System Restore** and select a date before the update. From my experience, 90% of the time it works all of the time. :-) Apart from that, review the other answers and see what will help your situation (since you did not mention what Windows version you are using). Happy hacking! ** Substituted from original text (Windows Recovery was incorrect - thank you to Richard Taylor for correcting my bad memory!)

For all I can understand you have only two possible solutions: Try to repair your Windows installation: at Windows boot up, you can press a key (usually F11) to repair your installation or you can get the repair procedure started booting from Windows Install DVD or from a repair disk previously created. Page on microsoft.comAccess your data with a Linux Live CD, copy it elsewhere (external hard drive, DVD, etc.) and re-install Windows.
